intro: Zeuxine affinis, commonly known as the broadleaf zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Zeuxine affinis is characterized by its basal leaves that are broadly ovate to elliptic in shape.
